main_definition: To grow, change or progress over time, often in terms of complexity, capability, or maturity.

meanings_and_examples.definition: To cause something to become more advanced or sophisticated.
meanings_and_examples.example: The company invests heavily in research and development to develop new products.

meanings_and_examples.definition: To become more skilled or proficient at a particular activity through practice or learning.
meanings_and_examples.example: She has developed her writing skills by reading many books and articles.

meanings_and_examples.definition: To bring something into existence or shape it in a particular way, often after some planning or preparation.
meanings_and_examples.example: The architect develops the blueprint of the building before construction begins.

meanings_and_examples.definition: To mature physically and mentally as one grows older.
meanings_and_examples.example: As children grow up, they develop their own personalities and preferences.

meanings_and_examples.definition: To expand or extend in size, range, scope, or value over time.
meanings_and_examples.example: The city has developed rapidly since the industrial revolution, growing into a large metropolis.
